body:
Rclone has socks5 proxy support: https://rclone.org/faq/#can-i-use-rclone-with-an-http-proxy

just start e.g. with:

	export http_proxy=socks5://proxyserver:1080
	export https_proxy=$http_proxy
	export HTTP_PROXY=$http_proxy
	export HTTPS_PROXY=$http_proxy
	rclone ...

Documentation is missing as described in #1861

> Rclone has socks5 proxy support: https://rclone.org/faq/#can-i-use-rclone-with-an-http-proxy
> 
> just start e.g. with:
> 
> ```
> export http_proxy=socks5://proxyserver:1080
> export https_proxy=$http_proxy
> export HTTP_PROXY=$http_proxy
> export HTTPS_PROXY=$http_proxy
> rclone ...
> ```
> 
> Documentation is missing as described in #1861

No, unfortunately you are confusing with the support of the socks for the http/s protocol. with Socks Type proxy you can incapsulate any protocols: sftp and so on.

rename.to: Socks5 Proxy Support for non HTTP/HTTPS

issue.title: [feature request] please add support for socks proxies

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
socks proxies are not yet supported by rclone. And proxywrappers like "proxychains" and "tsocks" do not work with golang based applications, for golang's own network libraries are usually statically linked and cannot be hooked. (https://github.com/rofl0r/proxychains-ng/issues/199)
It would be better to get socks proxies work with rclone.

rename.from: Socks5 Proxy Support for non HTTP/HTTPS
rename.to: SOCKS5 proxy support for FTP, SFTP

body:
The FTP client library used by rclone supports custom Dial func option: https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/jlaffaye/ftp#DialWithDialFunc
and we can feed it with https://pkg.go.dev/golang.org/x/net/proxy#Dialer
Also see an example of socks5 dialer and its usage for SSH/SFTP here: https://github.com/jpillora/chisel/pull/85/files#diff-d9f5e414c1e2bacd52fb93fa3f563c2a9ea30062f13ef7dc044324e436d3b20bR11
I'm yet curious how we can tweak rclone test suite to add a mock of socks5 proxy.

issue.title: add missing documentation of proxy support

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?

1.54.0

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?

(from https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/3558#issuecomment-533672691)

rclone has full `http`,`https`,`socks5` proxy support in most backends (http-based) https://rclone.org/faq/#can-i-use-rclone-with-an-http-proxy 

(`socks5` support in `sftp`,`ftp` backends is yet pending on #3558)

just start rclone as follows: 

```
export http_proxy=socks5://proxyserver:1080
export http_proxy=http://proxyserver:3128

export https_proxy=$http_proxy 
export HTTP_PROXY=$http_proxy 
export HTTPS_PROXY=$http_proxy 
rclone args... 
```

but documentation of this feature is still missing

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?

retest after #3558 is resolved, then add relevant instructions at the end of [docs.md](https://www.github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/master/docs/content/docs.md)

issue.title: Add socks_proxy support for ftp/sftp/ssh backend

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:

Add support for socks 5 proxies to the SFTP/SSH backend

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/3558
